column4: when i install ubuntu and its all done, and atlast when i try to log in, in the gdm, the whole system freezes after around 10 seconds, i got a ATI Radeon x600 Pro card, i really need help to fix this
i had the same problem in gentoo once, but i solved it somehow then in the kernel with something, but i can't remember how :/
did you install the fglrx binary driver?
append " s" to the boot line by pressing "a" in the boot menu.
then, when you get to the console, use dselect to [un] install stuff
use dselect. It'll explain itself to you
here's a tip tho, when you're in the Install screen, after you dismiss the help, press "/" and type something to search by name.
depends on the computer and card. I know it worked fine for me.
also, fglrx may have certain distribution restrictions.
gtkpod is a good starting place
it should do that by default
you might need an entry in /etc/fstab first
